paper_title.ja: フラクタル次元を援用した眺望景観記述の試論 -中世都市における主要施設からの山稜景観を事例として
paper_title.en: Tentative assumption of scene description used fractal dimension - Case study on the mountain ridge scene from the main institution in medieval town

description.ja: This paper described the morphological attribute of the mountain ridge scene in medieval town used fractal dimension. As a result, the known fact about similarity and differences of the location characteristic among main institutions of each city was verified. Furthermore, the morphological attribute of the mountain ridge scene from a main institution was able to be quantitatively described as follows. 1) Fractal dimension of a religion institution is low compared with the‘Gosho’residence. 2) The ‘Heian-kyo’ culture was imported and the paradise space which makes a mountain ridge scene a scenic backdrop was formed in medieval ‘Hiraizumi’ . 3) Scene complexity is low from geographical feature‘Yato’ in medieval ‘Kamakura’ as a military town

publication_name.ja: 日本都市計画学会論文集

paper_title.ja: 歴史的景観保全を目的とした絶対高さ型高度地区に関する研究
paper_title.en: STUDY ON THE HEIGHT RESTRICTIONS IN HISTORIC TOWNSCAPE ORIENTED HEIGHT-CONTROL-DISTRICTS

description.ja:
The purpose of this paper is to show the concept of restrictions in height-control-districts aimed to preserve historic townscape. The results are as follows;
1. Severe height restrictions designating narrow area make it possible to preserve historic streetscape and lessen non-conformed building.
2. Height restriction grading precisely around historic streetscape is effective for townscape preservation and space utilization.
3. Height restrictions should be determined by difference of elevation between landscape object and its surrounding area where preservation of landscape view is required.

paper_title.ja: 中世平泉の建物軸方向の特徴からみた市街地形態に関する一考察
paper_title.en: A STUDY ON THE URBAN FORM FROM THE VIEWPOINT OF THE CHARACTERISTIC OF BUILDING'S AXIS IN MEDIEVAL 'HIRAIZUM I', JAPAN

description.ja:
The purpose of this paper is to get the basic knowledge of ‘Hiraizumi' town, one of the medieva1 centra1city in Japan, from the four indexes of building's axis which explained to relation between building's axis, contour line，surrounding mountain landscape，streets and north-south's axis.
As a result，three conclusions were found. I'he first is that many buildings are not parallel to the streets. The second, there is little possibility of agreement with top of the mountains. The last, there is urban infrastructure like 'Jobo' urban system around Motsu-ji on the other hand not like it in Yanaginogosho. Therefore the Osyu Fujiwara family did no more than develop the blocks, and many buildings are supposed to be arranged according to owner's idea
description.en:
The purpose of this paper is to get the basic knowledge of 'Hiraizumi' town, one of the medieval central city in Japan, from the four indexes of building's axis which explained to relation between building's axis, contour line, surrounding mountain landscape, streets and north-south's axis.
As a result, three conclusions were found. The first is that many buildings are not parallel to the streets. The second, there is little possibility of agreement with top of the mountains. The last, there is urban infrastructure like 'Jobo' urban system around Motsu-ji, on the other hand not like it in Yanaginogosho. Therefore the Osyu Fujiwara family did no more than develop the blocks, and many buildings are supposed to be arranged according to owner's idea.

book_title.ja: スウェーデンの街と住まい

description.ja:
中世の都市ガムラスタン、スカンディナヴィア半島南部のハーフティンバーと石畳の街など、歴史や伝統との共生。
校倉式の壁、石造壁に藁屋根、簡素な中に暖かみを感じさせるスウェーデン民家と、田園との共生。
公共による住宅供給や合理的な集住のためのコレクティブハウスなど、都市部における人々の共生。
